intro: Vochysia gigantea, commonly known as the giant velvet tree, is a tropical tree native to South America. It is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces woody, fleshy fruits that contain seeds enclosed in a fibrous pulp. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of rainforests. The tree's botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
